I LOVE this game. I needed to get that out of the way.
But Left 4 Dead 2 has the entirety of Left 4 Dead's story along side of Left 4 Dead 2's story.
get this game for the Gmod textures (if that apply's to you) or get this game to support Value.
I recommend Left 4 Dead 2 if you want to play the original Left 4 Dead.

[i]Left 4 Dead[/i] is an addicting and extremely well built four person co-op zombie shooter with hours of content to offer the player.

When I think of zombies, usually I'm met with a distaste for the general idea. So many forms of media have run the idea into the ground, and many of the products are usually low quality and succeeded solely off of avid fans of zombie properties that couldn't get enough at the time when the craze reached its peak. Out of every zombie video game, two only really have stuck out to me due to their sheer quality and different approaches: [i]The Last of Us[/i] and [i]Left 4 Dead[/i]. Where something like the prior goes more for a focus on narrative, character growth, and the like, [i]Left 4 Dead[/i] takes a more action-oriented approach, but this works in its favor. The gameplay here that allows for such staying power is due to how accessible it is to all players, most people will know basic controls and know to kill the approaching enemies, and that's all you really need to know for a game like this. This is not to knock the quality, however, as it doesn't bog down the gameplay to the point where pro players can't have an enjoyable experience at all, it is masterfully balanced in this way.

 [i]Left 4 Dead[/i] has an arcade feel to it, with multiple different levels that are ultimately linear you replay over and over with different players to get a better outcome the next time, and with increased difficulty. Of course, there are other game modes as well, such as [i]Versus[/i], where other players take control of the zombies hunting your team down, and [i]Survival[/i], where you see exactly how long you and your team can survive the onslaught of enemies out to eat you alive. With all of this, along with the ability to download player-created maps, there is plenty of replayability here, and that is what the game is built for. For a game that is primarily focused on multiplayer and now is almost twelve years old, it is very impressive how long it has survived. Even with a sequel out, it still retains that staying power, and this should speak volumes about the quality of it. With only six base maps, one may get burnt out playing through it, which I can attest to to a point, but it really depends on the sort of player you are, as many others have thousands of hours put into this game, and if it's your sort of thing, you likely will as well. 

Overall, you can't go wrong with giving [i]Left 4 Dead[/i] a shot, there's so much replayability here mixed with stellar gameplay and unique enemy variety along with a good mix of difficulties for those who want more of a challenge and to keep it from getting repetitive. Alongside the already fruitful campaign mode, there are other game modes that add many more hours to your experience if you choose to interact with them. This is zombie apocalypse done in a very high quality way, and has helped assure players that [i]Valve[/i] no doubt knows what they are doing when the release anything under their prestigious name.

[b][RATING: 8.9/10][/b]
